contest-event.event-date: Sept. 30, 1905 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Roland a Ronceveaux Crystal Palace (Concert Hall), Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK Prizes: 1st: 40 Pounds plus 1000 Guinea Trophy (Total prize valued at £1,142.10s) 2nd: 30 Pounds plus triple silver plated tenor trombone 3rd: 20 Pounds plus 'Excelsior Sonorous' trombone 4th: 16 Pounds plus 'Imperial Supreme' trombone 5th: 12 Pounds plus 'Buffet' tenor horn 6th: 10 Pounds plus 'Class A' Cornet 7th: 5 Pounds plus 'Millereau' cornet 8th: 24 Band caps valued at 10 guineas 9th: Trombone valued at 7 guineas 10th: Post horn valued at £7 June 1, 2011, 12:54 p.m. Aug. 28, 2013, 1:40 p.m. 1 Irwell Springs William Rimmer 2 Wingates Band William Rimmer 3 Lee Mount Alexander Owen 4 Wyke William Rimmer 5 BMP (Europe) Goodshaw Band William Halliwell 6 Hebburn Colliery Angus Holden 7 Rushden Windmill Band Alexander Owen 8 Luton Band Angus Holden 9 Aberaman Thomas Valentine 10 Ferndale Samuel Radcliffe Unknown Result Spencer's Steelworks Prize Band Robert Rimmer Unknown Result Kingston Mills Band Alexander Owen Unknown Result Raunds Temperance Band H.
